name: Overnight Oats
description: No-cook breakfast prepared the night before. Creamy, customizable, and packed with fiber and protein.

instructions.instruction: Prepare two jars or deep bowls. Mason jars are ideal for portability.
Divide oats equally between the containers (1/2 cup each).
Add chia seeds and stir to combine.
instructions.tip: Chia seeds absorb liquid and create a creamy texture.

instructions.instruction: Add Greek yogurt. This adds protein and creaminess.
Add honey or maple syrup, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt.
instructions.tip: Salt balances sweetness and enhances flavor.

instructions.instruction: Pour in milk. Stir or shake thoroughly with a fork.
instructions.tip: Make sure everything is evenly distributed - no clumps.

instructions.instruction: Stir again within the first 5 minutes. This prevents chia seeds from clumping.
instructions.tip: This step is crucial - don't skip it.

instructions.instruction: Cover jars with lids or plastic wrap.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours, ideally overnight (8-12 hours).
instructions.tip: The longer it sits, the better the texture.

instructions.instruction: In the morning, remove from fridge and stir. Check consistency.
If too thick, add 1-2 tbsp milk and stir.
instructions.tip: Ideal consistency is like thick yogurt.

instructions.instruction: Top with blueberries, almond slices, and optional peanut butter. Serve.
instructions.tip: Add toppings just before eating so they stay fresh.

tips: Prep 5 portions on Sunday for ready breakfasts all week.
Use old-fashioned rolled oats - instant oats get too mushy.
Eat cold or microwave for 1 minute if you prefer warm.
Add protein powder to boost protein content.
For vegan version, use plant-based yogurt and milk.
storageInfo: Refrigerate in sealed container for up to 5 days. Add toppings fresh.
servingSuggestion: Eat cold directly from the jar or transfer to a bowl. Perfect for taking to work.
variations: Chocolate: Add 1 tbsp cocoa powder and chocolate chips.
Tropical: Use coconut milk, mango, and pineapple.
Apple pie: Add diced apple, extra cinnamon, and walnuts.
PB&J: Peanut butter and strawberry jam swirl.
